in the gap! Once again, batsman lucky. Good length, just outside off. Tries to fend, but it goes in the gap between second slip and gully

back of a length on fifth stump at 128 kph, delightful backfoot punch into the covers by Mayers, pulled back just before the rope for a triple.
full on fifth stump, swings away and left alone.
fullish length on middle and leg at 129 kph, flicked to deep fine leg to rotate the strike.
good length ball swings in on fourth stump at 128, Mayers goes back and across to defend and the ball shoots low past the toe edge and short hops Dickwella.
solid counterpunch from Mayers. Overpitched inswinger on fourth stump, drives this in the air perilously close to mid-off but it's just wide of him and bounces away to the rope.
back of a length on off at 128 kph, punched to backward point.
flighted full on off, smothered on the front foot.
flighted full again on off at 75 kph, defended again.
short now on fifth stump and spinning away, cuts this in front of point for a very long single.
good length ball on middle and off, defended.

back of a length on fifth stump, the width is there to attack with a gracefully assured back foot punch through the covers and he times it perfectly to go to the rope. Not much muscle, just pure technique took that to the rope.
good length ball straying on th elegs, flicks this behind square but not wide enough for a run.
full on fourth stump at 135 kph, flicked straight for a single. 50 partnership comes up off 69 balls. Solid reconstruction after two early blows.
oooh, beaten! Chameera angles this full across fifth stump at 135 kph, got the length and width to attack and goes hard at this but is beaten.
carbon copy play and miss from Mayers. A little more mustard on this from Chameera getting it up to 137 kph, full and wide as Mayers drives hard and is beaten again.
good length on fourth stump, goes back to defend.

three times now Mayers has played at this full and wide ball at 137 kph, this time he drives this loosely bending the back leg and skies a drive over cover, not timed well at all but plops halfway between the edge of the ring and the rope as they come back for two.
full length on off stump at 140 kph, punches forward and an inside edge goes to midwicket.
full on off, defended.
full on fifth stump, defended.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
good length ball on off stump, defended again.
very full on off, whipped along the ground straight to midwicket.
good length ball on off, flicked to midwicket again.

Chameera is persisting with these full and wide lengths outside off to encourage Mayers to drive but so far it's not producing an edge and Mayers punishes another overpitched delivery by smoking it through mid-off to the rope.
loose shot by Mayers and nearly pays for it. Good length ball on fourth stump, goes to pull, not nearly short enough for the shot and it whizzes by off stump.

edge! Just wide of third slip! Back of a length angled across fourth stump, gem of a ball gets him fending away from his body and sends an edge at chest height but it flies in the gap between third slip and gully to the rope. Would've been snapped up by an orthodox fourth slip.

fullish length on fourth stump, Mayers muscles this with a slap through midwicket for an extremely casual two. They thought it was gonna go to the rope but the hustle by the captain Dimuth Karunaratne charging across from mid-on dragged this back and they miss out on an easy third.

Edge! Mayers nearly pays the price for the lazy running on the previous ball! Back of a length on fourth stump, another poke by Mayers away from his body and the edge fails to carry to Nissanka at third slip.
back of a length on fourth stump, this time defended with a firm punch back down the wicket.

gem! Good length ball on middle, cuts Brathwaite in half as this nips back to clip the back pad on the way through a back foot defense. Big appeal denied, more for caught behind than lbw. They opt against reviewing it, wisely.
good length ball defended.

back of a length on off at 137 kph, defended.

beaten! Fullish length angled across fourth stump at 132 kph, Brathwaite fiddles at this with no footwork and is late. Mayers comes down the pitch to have a chat.
fullish length ball on off, pushed to mid-off, sloppy misfield ricochets further down the ground to allow a single.
fullish length ball on fourth stump, swats this in the air down the ground through mid-on, not timed well but safely clears mid-on for a pair.

good length ball punched into the off side.

just like last over, follows up a no ball with a boundary. No free hits in Test cricket but you wouldn't know it from the way West Indies are attacking him after the oversteps. Too short on the legs, hammers a pull through midwicket to the rope. About as aggressive as it gets from Brathwaite.

overpitched and straying on the legs, flicks this elegantly through wide mid-on against the turn of the left-arm spinner and it is timed exquisitely to the rope. 50 partnership up off 64 balls, second half-century stand of the day.

strikes first up! Caught at slip! Floated this up full and wide on seventh stump, Holder reaching out a long way without much footwork for a booming cover drive and instead a thick edge flies to Thirimanne's right at chest height. He reaches across his body and takes this comfortably. There looked like a touch of drift from the overspin that took the ball a fraction away from Holder before it pitched and that was enough to produce an edge.

awful awful shot for someone new to the crease. Da Silva sweeps a full ball on middle and misses badly. Umpire Brathwaite triggers him quickly and deservedly so. Da Silva calls for a review. Seems pretty hopeless. He was hit low in front of middle. Only hope is if it was spinning down leg. But Da Silva starts walking off before the ball-tracking comes up on the big screen. If he knew he didn't hit it, why did he review? Seems resigned to his fate. Ball-tracking shows it was going down leg!!! Da Silva was almost at the boundary rope and now has to turn around and come back with a sheepish grin on his face. Mickey Arthur is irate and waving his arms furiously!

full on leg. Flicked to the gap near square leg for a single
full, on middle. On drive to midwicket
good length, on leg. Shuffles across and works it to the big gap at midwicket. Enough time to risk the second run. Da Silva flicks the throw onto the stumps but Thiri is safe

fullish, wide outside off from around the stumps. Left alone

defended off the back foot

Replays look like he played through the shot too early and the ball rolled off the back of the bat blade to Da Silva. Ultraedge is showing no spike and a gap when he plays the shot initially on the front of the bat face but a spike appears when the ball passes the back of the bat blade on the bowed portion. The third umpire is having some doubt because Dhananjaya's body is obscuring the bat from the side-on replay angle on the point/off side. short and wide on sixth stump, cuts this to backward point.

fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
fuller again, just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball around off, a bit of a drift. Defended on the back foot
length ball on middle and leg, lunges forward and defends it on the leg side
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, defended
short of length around off, stays back and punches it towards long-on
a dipping full toss down the leg side, sweeps it towards fine leg for a couple
flatter and quicker around off, 105 kph. Comes forward and pushes it towards wide long-off
length ball on middle and leg, swipes it towards deep-backward square leg
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
length outside off, moving away. Left alone. On the bounce to the keeper
length ball, around fifth stump and moving away, nice shape there. Nissanka shoulders arms
length ball outside off, once again leaving the batsman. Left alone
length outside off, swing and seam, away from the batsman. Nissanka was looking to chase it but withdraws his bat at the last moment
short of length this time, again going away from the batsman. Left alone
length ball around off, gets on his toes and defends
length ball in the channel and angling away. Ignored
length ball outside off, punches it towards backward point. Was looking for a quick single but better sense prevails in the end
short of length outside off, throws his bat at it, and gets it over the gully fielder for four
length ball angling away, left alone
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg. 200 is up for Sri Lanka
fuller outside off, comes on the front foot and presents the full face. A couple of runs as mid-off puts in the chase
short of length outside off, drops it towards cover-point and sets. An attempted direct hit at the bowler's end, misses but Dickwella was in anyway
length outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, swinging away. Left alone. Joseph need to land those in the line of the off stump
this is much better. A bit wide of the crease but in the line of the off stump. A length ball, defended on the back foot
fuller this time, just around off, smothered
play and a miss. Fuller and angling away, Dickwella chases it and gets beaten
length ball around off, defended towards extra cover from the crease
length ball in the channel, left alone

An appeal for caught-behind. Denied but West Indies belatedly opt to review it. A length ball around off, this one nips back in to find Dickwella stuck in his crease. Sneaks in through the gap between bat and pad but did it touch the bat on its way to the keeper? It definitely brushed the thigh. The UltraEdge shows there was an inside edge too before that. Dickwella walks back, Sri Lanka in trouble at 203 for 6
nips back in. A length ball outside off and it goes on to hit the batsman high on the thigh. Gets a leg-bye behind point
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but it hits the toe end of the bat. Gets a couple in the cover region
length ball but straying down the leg side. Fails to connect the flick
length outside off, pushes it towards cover-point
short of length but way outside off. Left alone
flies past the gully fielder, Hayden Walsh there. It was fuller outside off and Lakmal threw his bat at it
fuller around off, pushes at it and gets it towards square leg off the inner half of the bat
length ball down the leg side, goes for the flick but the ball is far away from the bat
fuller outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards point
length ball outside off, comes forward and taps it towards cover
short of length around off, hops and defends it past short leg
short of length around off, defended on the back foot
short of length outside off, some width there. Cuts it towards cover. Hayden Walsh from point slides and fumbles to allow the second run
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length on sixth stump, left alone.

loose shot flicked to midwicket/short mid-on. Fullish length ball on fourth stump, Lakmal tried to whip this on the up but miscues it off an inside half of the bat and the ball flutters gently to Brathwaite adjacent to the non-striker for a simple catch at waist height.
tries to spear in a yorker on off stump at 139 kph but Chameera spears it out.
back of a length on fifth stump at 137 kph, left alone.
good length ball in the channel on fifth stump at 137 kph, left alone.
fullish length ball swinging away from sixth stump at 134 kph, left alone.
overpitched on off stump at 131 kph, flicked through wide mid-on before Gabriel kicks it back to keep it to two.
full on off at 126 kph, defended.
good length ball on off stump, goes back and across to flick into the leg side for a single to midwicket.
starts with a bouncer but it's straying down the leg side, Chameera ducks under
short of length outside off, left alone

struck on the helmet. Another bouncer, this time right at the batsman. Chameera takes his eyes off and it hits him on the side of the helmet. Holder checks on the batsman immediately. Thankfully, he looks okay. The physio is out for the concussion protocols. And it all looks fine
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball in the channel, left alone
short of length outside off, punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, hangs back and defends it awkwardly towards point
beaten! A length ball outside off, Chameera hangs his bat out but luckily it's just inside the line of the ball
length outside off, pushes it towards covers
short but down the leg side. Chameera ducks under
short and some room outside off, cuts it over the backward point fielder for a couple
short of length around off, pushes it towards extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and defends
fuller on the stumps, looks to block but the ball hits the outer half of the bat and rolls towards backward point/gully
short of length outside off and moving away. Nissanka was looking to play at it first but changes his mind at the last moment
too full around off. Driven towards extra cover
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but ends up mistiming it towards mid-on
length outside off, just nips back in to cut the batsman in half, but it's well away from the off stump

short of length outside off, rises with the bounce and cuts it down past the diving point fielder Hayden Walsh there who is on the field for Bonner. It goes to his right and races away to the boundary
length ball around off, pushes it towards extra cover and retains the strike with that single
length ball around off, stays in his crease and blocks
short of length outside off, punches it towards deep point for one
short of length around off, defended off the back foot
short of length around off, gets behind it and blocks
beats the outside edge. Short of length angling in towards the batsman but it holds its line after pitching and beats the defensive push
short of length around off, comes forward to defend. From the outer half of the bat
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards deep square leg
fuller, in the channel. Chameera pushes at it and gets beaten as the ball moves away
a bouncer. Chameera once again takes his eyes off and it hits him on the shoulder. Lobs over the slip cordon
length ball around off, comes forward and defends
short of length outside off, punches it through covers for a couple
fuller down the leg side, misses the flick
fuller, just outside off, pushes at it and misses. Wasn't far away from the off stump
short of length rising towards the batsman. Does well to get on his toes and defend it down
short of length around off, goes back and blocks
length ball angling in. Looks to defend on the front foot but ends up playing inside the line. Beaten

an outside edge and taken. Holder finally gets the reward for his consistency. Was a length ball, just around off stump, forcing the batsman ti play at it. Chameera looks to defend but can only manage and outside edge. Da Silva pouches a regulation catch
fuller on the stumps, just hangs his bat in front. The ball hits the inner half and rolls towards square leg. They don't take the single
short of length around off, hops and defends it towards extra cover
short of length outside off, some width, goes for the cut and misses
short of length outside off, swivels and pulls it wide of mid-on. Not the best of the timings. And they scamper back for the second
fuller on the stumps, clips it towards square leg. Takes the sinlge
fuller outside off, hangs his bat and pushes it towards point
length but way outside off, left alone
short of length outside off, hops and pushes it towards gully. A diving stop there
fuller but way down the leg side. Da Silva cannot reach there but these have been called byes
length ball around off, comes forward to defend but the extra bounce means the ball hits near the sticker and rolls towards deep square leg. Nissanka isn't interested in the single
fuller on the pads, flicked towards fine leg for one
length ball angling in. Defended on the front foot
back of length outside off, stays back and defends it square of the wicket on the off side
fuller in the channel and swinging away. Left alone
length, width outside off, goes for the cut and misses
short of length around off, hops and dabs it behind the stumps, in the direction of gully for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, defended
short of length around off, defended from the back foot
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, slapped through covers for a couple of runs
fuller on the stumps, whipped towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps, flicked straight towards midwicket
length ball at the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on and sets off. Gabriel picks up the ball and aims for the direct hit off-balance. Misses and Nissanka survives
length ball angling away but too far from the batsman. Left alone
short on off, Nissanka pulls Joseph high over midwicket but not timed well and the ball plops well short of the rope for a jogged two to keep strike.
what class! Short on fifth stump again, this time leans back to uppercut this over the slips. Effortless shot, maximum efficiency.
short on middle this time at 138 kph, pulled along the ground to deep backward square.

good length ball angled into the thigh, goes to flick this away but is late and it thuds into the exposed area just above the knee flap but below the thigh guard. Embuldeniya is rubbing that part of his leg vigorously now.
good length ball defended.
good length ball on middle at 136 kph, defended.
good length ball on off, defended.
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but almost chops on
short of length outside off, goes for the cut and misses
and that's his fifty. Well played, young man. Fuller and wider outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover

fuller on the stumps, goes for the flick but misses. Called no-ball by the on-field umpire. A no-ball because Gabriel's foot cut the return crease. Replays show it would have been umpire's call on stumps for lbw in case it was a legal delivery
whoa! They take a single there. Length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg and they are happy with the single
fuller but way outside off
length ball in the channel. Left alone
length ball angling in, left alone
fuller outside off, jams his bat at it and gets past the diving gully fielder
length ball around off, defended from the crease
a touch fuller outside off, left alone
short of length down the leg side, looks to defend but is hit on the thigh pad
short of length at the batsman, gets behind it and blocks
short of length but straying down the leg side, Nissanka looks to get some bat on it but missed
short of length around off, rises with the ball and tucks away in front of square leg
short of length at the body, looks to dab it down. Misses and gets hit on the body
fuller on the stumps, defended
short of length but down the leg side. Nissanka moves outside the line of the ball and lets it go
short of length outside off, pulls it down towards deep-forward square leg but doesn't take the single
short again and pulled in front of square leg. Right from the middle of the bat but straight towards the fielder

another short one and Nissanka once again goes for the pull. Gets a top edge and it goes right into the lap of Hayden Walsh at deep-backward square leg. It wasn't a percentage shot, so I feel he should have ducked under those bouncers
a bouncer to welcome him to the crease. Manages to duck under and sway away from it

and that's it. Roach has wrapped up the innings here. A length ball angling in, Fernando like a typical No. 11 was looking to go towards the leg side while poking his bat at it. Gets an outside edge and a simple catch for Da Silva
fuller around off, a bit of shape away. Pushed back towards the bowler
fuller in the channel and moving away but almost rolls towards the keeper
length ball around middle and off and shaping away. Brathwaite was going across and defends it in front of his left pad
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards square leg
length ball in the channel. Left alone
fuller around off, defended. A maiden to start with
length ball around off, defended
length ball, just outside off, punched back
length again. Campbell walks towards the bowler and defends

an appeal for lbw but denied. Sri Lanka want to review it. A length ball that kept coming in with the angle to hit the front pad as Campbell went for the flick. There was some bat involved as well and Sri Lanka think it's pad first. The third umpire deems it was bat first and Campbell survives
length ball around off, defended
fuller outside off, driven past extra cover. Lakmal jogs after that and allows a chance to go for the third. Good running from the West Indies openers
length ball around off, walks down the track and defends it with bat and pad close
length ball angling in, tucked away towards short midwicket. Lakmal has overstepped here, just
once again walks towards the bowler but it's way outside off. Left alone. The benefit of using the feet is Lakmal has pulled his length back
short of length and well outside off, left alone
short of length but around tenth stumps I guess. Left alone
advances once again and drops it towards extra cover. An easy single as Campbell was already half-way down the track
length ball but down the leg side. Brathwaite attempts a tickle but misses
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller outside off, gets down on one knee and drives it through covers. First four of the innings
length ball outside off. A bit of shape away, left alone
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, walks down towards the bowler again and blocks
length ball in the channel. Left alone. Bounces again on its way to the keeper
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it towards short midwicket
length ball outside off and moving away. Left alone
length ball around off, tucked away behind square leg for a couple
fuller outside off, was looking to play at it first but withdraws just in time
length ball angling in towards the stumps, defended on the leg side
fuller around off, pushes it towards covers
length ball outside off, dabs it towards gully
fuller outside off, steered towards the right of gully. The fielder gets a hand to it
length ball on the pads, misses the flick and is hit on the pads. Was heading down though

fuller on the stumps, flicked it behind square leg for a couple. Looks like Embuldeniya has hurt himself while fielding that ball. He put in the slide but then couldn't get up. He is in some pain, looks like its the thigh. This looks serious. The physio is out. Mickey Arthur is concerned as well in the dressing room. A stretcher is out on the field. Embuldeniya has been put on the stretcher and taken out
fuller but well outside off, goes for the mock drive, playing well inside the line of the ball. Similar to mock Gibbs forward defence
length ball outside off, around sixth stump. Now Campbell pulls out the mock defence
fuller outside off, driven on the front foot but straight towards extra cover
short of length on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, plays around his front pad and flicks it behind square leg

Given caught-behind. A length ball around off, Campbell walks forward and looks to defend. Misses and an appeal for caught-behind. Campbell is having a chat with Brathwaite and belatedly opts to review it. It's clearly from the replays that he got an outside edge. UltraEdge confirms that and Campbell walks back for 10. West Indies lose a review

fuller and swinging away, goes for the flick and misses. An appeal for lbw but given not out. Sri Lanka review this time. The ball-tracking shows only about 35% of the ball was hitting leg stump. So it's umpire's call and Blackwood survives

short of length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground. Blackwood is aware that it may bounce on to the stumps and is ready to kick it away. No need for that though as it bounces well away from the stumps
fuller but way, way outside off, left alone
fuller on the pads, tucked away in front of square leg. A bit of a misfielding and that allows a single
short of length on the pads, and tucked away fine. Off the mark with a four
fuller but way outside off, left alone
length ball around off, defended towards covers from the crease
length ball on the pads, goes for the flick but misses. A loud appeal for lbw but given not out. Sri Lanka don't review this time. Might have been pitched outside leg
good length ball on fifth stump, left alone.
fullish length on fourth stump, prodded into the off side.
strays on the legs at 128 kph, goes to flick and is late, clips the pads and beats Dickwella diving down the leg side for four extras.
good length ball on off, defended.
good length ball on off stump, defended.
back of a length on fifth stump at 130 kph, left alone.
good length ball on off, defended.
too full on the legs, comes off the pads after missing a flick and goes behind square for a pair of leg byes.
full on the legs at 135 kph, defended.
back of a length on the legs at 130 kph, misses a flick and it comes off the thigh to the leg side to pinch another extra.
full on the legs at 133 kph, flicked off the bat this time behind square for a casual pair.
good length ball angled across fifth stump, left alone.
back of a length on off, defended.
back of a length angled into the hips at 130 kph, can't flick it away.
back of a length on middle, goes back to flick behind square for one.

chaos! Nearly a runout but Sri Lanka blow the relay! Clear missed chance. Full on the legs, flicked to deep backward square for a long single, Brathwaite was busting it coming back for two all the way but Blackwood wasn't terribly interested with the throw about to be launched from deep backward square to the bowler's end. A one bounce relay comes to the non-striker's stumps with Brathwaite six yards short of his ground but Dimuth, who ran to the stumps from mid-off, can't collect the one bounce throw. It came to him at a comfortable height on the skid but he fumbled it very badly. He tried to rush a catch and swipe at the stumps in one motion - unnecessarily too with Brathwaite long gone - instead of focusing on collecting the ball first before gently taking off the bails.
fullish length on the stumps, lofted drive clears mid-on for an easy pair.
good length ball, can't get it away.
good length ball on off, defended.
good length ball on off, defended.
short and wide at 128 kph, cuts this behind point and they scamper three.
back of a length way outside off, left alone, too wide to play at even for Test standards and a wide is called.

edge! Dropped at first slip! Thirimanne the culprit! In the channel on fifth stump angled in and then holds its line to seam away, thick edge to Thirimanne comes to him at the beltline height along his right hip, he's falling off balance to his right as he snatches at this and it winds up clanging off the base of his palm. Didn't come close to the fingertips. Quite a mess made of a straightforward slips chance.
good length ball on the legs, flicked through square leg.
good length ball, defended.
flighted full on fifth stump, defended.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended.
good length ball outside off, left alone.
fuller now on the stumps and punched down the ground for a single.
good length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
fractionally short on fifth stump, Brathwaite picks the length early and slaps this through extra cover, racing away to the rope.
back of a length on the hips, Blackwood flicks this easily through fine leg to the rope.
too full on off stump swinging in a touch at 133 kph, goes to flick through midwicket and clips a long single.
back of a length on off stump at 126 kph, flicked to square leg.
back of a length on off, flicked to square leg again.
good length ball defended.
good length ball flicked to square leg.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes to cut and misses.
full on seventh stump, goes on a knee to slog this and slices it high over cover for a long single, falls well short of the sweeper.
full on off, whipped to short mid-on.
full on off again, flicked to short mid-on again.
full on fourth stump, driven to mid-off.
good length ball on fourth stump, goes back to defend and it shoots low but still kept out.
too full on middle and leg, flicked behind square for a long single.
back of a length on off, defended to midwicket.
back of a length on off, flicked to backward square leg.
back of a length on fourth stump at 138 kph, defended with an inside edge off the feet before a ricochet takes it just wide of the stumps.
full on fourth stump, punched back past Chameera and races through mid-off, mid-on comes across to slap it back in to turn four into two.
back of a length on off, defended.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to punch through cover.
back of a length ball on fourth stump, left alone.
flighted full on off, defended.
full on off, defended to mid-on.
back of a length on fifth stump, punched to mid-off.
full on off, defended.
back of a length on fifth stump at 137 kph, defended.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to short mid-on.
short ball on fifth stump, goes to duck under this 142 kph ball but it keeps quite low and nearly clangs off his periscoped bat.
back of a length on off, swivels with a leg in the air Greenidge style for a pull along the ground through square leg.
back of a length on off at 141 kph, defended.
back of a length on fifth stump at 138 kph, defends inside the line as it passes through to Dickwella.
good length ball on fourth stump, flicked to mid-on.
full on fourth stump, defended.

back of a length on fifth stump, left alone. Uproarious appeal for stumping from Dickwella asking umpire Brathwaite at square leg to refer this because batsman Brathwaite temporarily lifted his back leg. The umpire says play on.
good length ball on off, defended.
good length ball on off, flicked to the infield.
good length ball on the hips, flicked to square leg.
back of a length on off at 138 kph, defended.
short ball sails over off stump as Brathwaite sways back.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended.
bouncer on fourth stump at 145 kph, leans back to uppercut this but gets nowhere close.

the short ball plan finally comes off for Chameera! Continued to bang this in short on fourth/fifth stump line, Blackwood is slightly cramped going for an orthodox cut rather than the uppercut/ramp he tried to the same type of ball on the previous delivery. Thin edge goes through comfortably to Dickwella.
back of a length on middle at 137 kph, Mayers goes back to tap this with soft hands into midwicket to get off the mark quickly.
full on off, defended.
good length ball on the legs, can't flick this away.
full on middle, defended.
good length ball on fourth stump, punched to mid-off for a single.
full on off, whipped to mid-on.
full on off, defended.
bounces Mayers on leg stump, flinches under this.

nearly another wicket via the short ball! Bounces him again and goes to pull this time, was in the air for awhile but the sub fielder Ashen Bandara at deep square leg couldn't cover the ground in time with Mayers hitting into the wind.
full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket.
good length ball on fifth stump at 139 kph, left alone.
bouncer on off stump, Brathwaite ducks under.
back of a length on fourth stump at 138 kph, defended into the covers.
good length ball on the legs, goes back to flick through square leg.
full on off, defended.
too full on middle and leg, flicked along the ground through midwicket for one.
good length ball straying on the legs, goes  back to flick but can't get it away.
straying on the legs again, goes back to flick and it comes off the pads past the keeper for one.
good length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
back of a length ball on the stumps, goes back to defend.
bouncer on fifth stump, Mayers reaches out to uppercut flick this over the slips cordon very safely and it goes to the rope.
good length ball on the legs, flicked behind square for a single.
back of a length on off at 140 kph, Brathwaite back and across in defense.
back of a length on off again at 137 kph, defended on the back foot again.
back of a length on sixth stump at 137 kph, Brathwaite plays well away from his body to defend but is in bat on ball mode and blocks it out easily.
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, goes for the drive. Gets an inside edge on to the pads
another inside out on to the pads as Mayers comes forward to defend
length outside off, defended
length, straying down the leg side. Misses the flick but gets a leg bye to fine leg
fuller around off, drives it towards extra cover
short but down the leg side. Ignored
short of length down the leg side. Looks to flick but misses
short of length on the stumps, tucked away behind square leg
fuller around off, pushes it to the left of mid-off for a quick single
short of length, rising towards the batsman. Mayers fends at it and gets hit near the neck/chin area
another attempted bouncer. Fends again. Shouts of catch it but it's away on the off side. Not sure if there was any bat or glove involved
fuller, pushes back towards the bowler
lunges forward to this length ball and blocks
fuller around off, blocked on the front foot
length ball on the stumps, defended on the leg side
too full around off, smothered on the front foot
length ball around off, turns it towards short leg
short again, Mayers isn't comfortable against those but manages to work it towards fine leg
short of length outside off, works it towards short midwicket
length ball, way outside off, left alone
fuller around off, not much foot work but manages to punch it past wide-ish mid-off for three
short again, right at the batsman. Mayers does well this time to sway away from the ball

short but down the leg side. Attempts an awkward pull, I think he took his eyes off the ball. Misses and it hits him on the grille. Gets a leg-bye to fine leg. The physio is out as per the concussion protocols
fuller around off and middle. Drives it towards extra cover
length ball on middle and leg, goes deep and flicks it behind square leg. Picks up a boundary
length ball around off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
tossed up outside off, but too full. Driven straight towards extra cover

a huge appeal for lbw but the umpire isn't interested. Sri Lanka have gone for the review. It was an arm ball. pitching on a length around off and beating the inside edge to hit in front. That looked close. No bat involved, UltraEdge confirms. The impact is umpire's call, just around the off stump. Wickets too are umpire's call. Was just clipping the bails and Mayers survives
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards deep extra cover
short of length at the batsman, doesn't rise much. Hops and pushes it towards mid-on
length outside off, punches off the back foot but short extra cover moves to his right to intercept it
length outside off, punches it towards the left of mid-off for one more
short and swivels to pull it towards deep-backward square leg. Mayers wasn't in control but it just cleared the man in the deep, who wasn't exactly at the boundary
short again, Mayers looks to pull but it's down the leg side. No connection
short of length at the stumps, backs away and goes for the pull but misses
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball angling on towards the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket for a couple
fuller around off, drives on the front foot but a diving extra cover makes the stop
looked like an arm ball. A big stride forward from Mayers to block it
fuller outside off, driven to the right of the cover fielder
short and this time Mayers is in complete control. Pulls it between forward square leg and deep-backward square leg. Finds the boundary
another short one, right at the batsman. Mayers sways away from it but ends up on his backside
another short one. On middle and leg. Mayers ducks under it this time
lobs up but there is no silly point. Short of length around off. Hops and fends but takes his bottom hand off. Off the face of the bat but falls safe
a top edge this time. Short and Mayers goes for the pull. Gets it towards fine leg. Third man sprints across and flicks it inside. Not the best of the running between the wickets
length outside off, pushes it towards extra cover for a quick single
fuller around off, defended on the front foot
fuller outside off, whips it towards the leg side. Short mid-on makes a diving stop
pitched up again, works it towards midwicket for one
length ball on the pads, just flick and it races away to the midwicket boundary
fuller outside off, driven but straight towards extra cover
a bit aerial but safe. Goes for the drive again but isn't to the pitch of the ball. Off the outer half of the bat towards backward point
fuller outside off, pushes it towards extra cover
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards deep-backward square leg. They complete two before fine leg moves across and throws it back
length ball around off, stays back and pushes it towards mid-on
short of length outside off, goes back and across and works it towards the right of mid-on. I feel there was a single there but Brathwaite didn't look interested
a bouncer. Brathwaite ducks under it comfortably
fuller on the pads, tucked away towards deep midwicket
length outside off, pushes it towards covers for one
length ball on the pads, pushes it towards mid-on
length ball outside off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, driven towards long-off. Those two have added 50 now
length ball on the stumps, punched back
length ball around off, defended down the wicket
short but not that quick, pulls it towards deep midwicket. Gets two before the deep square leg can come across and cut it off
short of length, gets in two minds, whether to leave or pull. Ends up dabbing it towards point with a bent back. Was in the air but safe

dropped by Oshada at short leg. Was a length ball around off. Brathwaite looked to work it on the leg side but the ball instead lobbed towards short leg, just over his head. He got both hands to it but it went through
short and wide. Chases it and misses
fuller on the stumps, moves across and flicks it uppishly towards short fine leg
another short one but just outside off. Brathwaite ducks under it without any fuss
length ball outside off, punches towards deep extra cover off the back foot
too full on the stumps. Digs it back towards the bowler
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, whipped towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket once more
pitched up around off, lunges forward and blocks
length outside off, punches it off the back foot. Didn't look like he hit it that hard but the placement was excellent as was the timing. Races away to the point boundary
fuller around off, driven towards sweeper cover from the front foot
length ball around off, looks to defend but gets it from the outer half. The ball rolls towards cover. Brathwaite was looking for a quick single but sent back by Mayers
length ball on the stumps, tucked away towards midwicket
a length ball, well outside off. Mayers moves across and punches it wide of mid-on. Not from the middle of the bat but still had enough legs on it to reach the boundary
moves across again to the length ball and looks to swipe it towards square leg this time. Gets an inside edge on to the body
short of length, goes back and pulls but no power behind that. Short midwicket comes in the way
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball outside off, stays back and works it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, driven towards sweeper cover for one
works it towards wide mid-on for one more
length outside off, keeps coming in with the angle. Left alone
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, looks to push at it and gets beaten
that's fifty for Mayers and he reaches there in style. Short of length outside off, rocks back and pulls it past short midwicket
length ball outside off, punches it towards mid-off from the back foot
fuller around off, stays in the crease and blocks
length ball outside off, pushes it towards extra cover
full on off, whipped through wide mid-on, dragged back at the rope for three.
short on the stumps, flicked square for a pair.
back of a length on off, defended.
back of a length on off, goes back to flick this to mid-on.
good length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
full and wide on sixth stump, driven square to backward point.
good length ball on the stumps at 127 kph, defended to midwicket.
good length ball on off at 130 kph, flicked to midwicket off the back foot.
too full on leg stump at 126 kph, flicked to midwicket again.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended back to Lakmal.
overpitched on fourth stump at 127 kph, punches this but straight to mid-off.
back of a length on off stump at 128 kph, defended to mid-on.
full on fourth stump, defended to short mid-off.
back of a length on fourth stump, punched to the off side.
full outside off on fourth stump, punches this uppishly in the air just wide of short extra cover.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended.
back of a length a touch wider on fifth stump, this time enough room to guide this behind point.
short and wide, slaps this to cover on the ring.

good length ball on fourth stump at 129 kph punched into cover, cleanly fielded for no run but an absurd shy at the non-striker's stumps by the sub fielder Dasun Shanaka - when Mayers was well in his crease - and it is not backed up, allowing two overthrows.
back of a length on off, defended to mid-on.
back of a length on off stump, defended into midwicket.
back of a length on fifth stump, defended.
back of a length on sixth stump this time at 126 kph, slaps this wide of cover in the gap for more runs.

angled into the pads from around the stumps, Mayers goes to pull a good length ball that doesn't bounce as high as expected and he's hit in front of middle, given out by umpire Brathwaite and Mayers calls for the review. This looks pretty out. Only doubt was on height. The ball wasn't nearly short enough to be playing that pull. Ball-tracking shows umpire's call on the height with the ball clanging the top of middle. Mayers has to go.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
darted flatter and fuller on off, defended.
slightly short and wide, slaps this to cover.
full on middle, flicked to midwicket but gets it into a gap.
full outside off on sixth stump, Holder leans forward and punches this elegantly with a high elbow, splits extra cover and mid-off before skittling to the rope.
full on fifth stump, presses forward to defend.
back of a length on fourth stump, flicked to midwicket.
back of a length on off, punches this back down the pitch past the non-striker and pinches a tight single.
good length ball on off, defended.
good length ball on fifth stump, presses away from his body and is beaten.
fullish length wide outside off, shovels this uppishly but it doesn't carry to the cover fielder.
fuller and wider, plays this along the ground through cover and finds a gap to collect a pair.
full on sixth stump, driven to extra cover.
full on fifth stump, whipped to midwicket.
full on sixth stump, more width and Brathwaite attacks but drives straight to extra cover.
fuller and straighter now, flicks this through the leg side for one.
full on middle, flicked along the turf to long-on.
back of a length on fifth stump, guides this behind point for one.
good length ball on off, flicked into midwicket.
attempted slower ball yorker winds up as a low full toss on off at 104 kph, flicks this to midwicket.
back of a length on off, goes back and across to flick behind square. 50 up for Brathwaite off 137 balls. 21st half-century for him to follow up his first innings ton.
back of a length on fifth stump, goes back to punch but it shoots low.
hello! Length ball on fifth stump, in the slot for a classic one-day heave flat back over mid-off, two bounces and to the rope.
good length ball on fourth stump, shoots a touch low at 128 kph as Holder leaves it be.
good length ball on off, defended.
short on fifth stump, slaps this behind point and they come back for a very tight second.
good length ball on fourth stump, defends forward and a thick edge goes behind point.
full on off, strokes this along the ground to long-on.
good length ball on the stumps, defended.
back of a length on middle, goes back to defend again.
good length ball on off, goes back to flick this past forward short leg through square for one.
fullish length ball on off stump, punches this on the up back down the ground and it races through mid-off before being dragged back before the rope.
bouncer over middle stump at 134 kph, Holder ducks under it.
back of a length ball on fourth stump, sits up for him to pull this over midwicket and trickles to the rope.
good length ball on fourth stump at 135 kph, left alone.
full on off, flicked to short midwicket.
full on middle, flicked to midwicket.
short on fifth stump, slapped to extra cover.
good length ball on off stump, defended.
short and wide, slaps this behind point.
full on middle and leg, flicked through square leg.
bouncer on the stumps, ducks under it.
short on fifth stump, left alone.
bangs this in short on the body at 138 kph, gets back and across to defend.
another short ball angled into the ribs. Climbs on Holder and pings him in the ribs. He lets out a howl.
short ball angled outside off, left alone.
short into the ribs again, this time Holder shuffles to get well inside the line to flick this behind square for one.
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller outside off, drives on the front foot but cannot beat short extra cover
fuller on the stumps, driven along the ground towards long-on
fuller outside off, Brathwaite is on the back foot and leaves it alone
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and turns it on the leg side
length ball on the stumps, backs away and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball in the channel, left alone
length again, much closer to the batsman this time. Chops it towards extra cover
length outside off, slaps it towards point but straight towards the fielder
length ball outside off, pushed towards mid-on from back foot
fuller and angling away. Brathwaite tries to reach out for it with an attempted cut but fails to connect
a short one at the batsman. Brathwaite sways away. And that's a maiden
length ball around off, stays back and opens the face of the bat to work it to the right of first slip but no run as the fielder chases it quickly
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on
pitched up, digs it out towards short midwicket
short of length, goes back and pulls it over short midwicket. Not in complete control but will get two
fuller on the stumps, driven towards mid-on
short of length around off, backs away and punches it towards extra cover
fuller outside off, comes forward and steers it past the gully fielder for four
short of length around off, drops it towards cover and sets off
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length outside off, stays leg side of the ball and taps it towards point
length ball at the stumps, punched back towards the bowler
a full toss outside off, but Brathwaite fails to put that away. Ends up hitting straight towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on
length ball around off, lunges forward and defends with soft hands
down the track and goes over mid-on. Didn't quite get the hold of it, more from the toe end of the bat but it dribbles over the boundary line
length ball on middle and leg. Works it towards square leg. And that's a front foot no-ball
fired in quick, just outside off. Brathwaite was on the back foot and had no chance to do anything about it
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on. The mid-on is now back
flatter around off, 87kph. Defended on the back foot
length ball around off, punches it towards mid-off
short of length outside off, punched down the ground. The bowler gets his hand to it
short but doesn't rise as much. Brathwaite pulls it down but ends up hitting it straight towards short midwicket
a full toss on the stumps and Brathwaite puts it away, flicked between mid-on and midwicket
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards mid-on
fuller and angling away. Left alone
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg. The backward square leg fielder was quick to the ball
looks to paddle it fine but fails to execute. Hits the toe end of the bat and drops down the pitch
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, turns it towards square leg
fuller around off, drives it to the left of mid-off and sets off
almost in the blockhole. Just outside off. Squeezes it out towards short midwicket
fuller outside off, drives it towards extra cover
length ball around off, stays back and defends it on the leg side
length ball around off, defended on the off side

length ball on the stumps, taps it on the leg side and sets off. The square leg fielder moves towards the ball swiftly, collects and aims at the non-striker's end. A direct hit and Holder would have been out. He had in fact given up
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks but de Silva has overstepped
a deft touch to fine leg and Brathwaite is coming back for the third. The lead is 300 now
length outside off, punches it towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, driven past the diving short midwicket. Long-on cuts it off
length ball, quicker on the stumps, looks to defend. Gets an inside edge on to the pads
length ball on middle and leg, defended
fuller outside off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the pads, flicked away fine and gets a boundary. Moves to 80. And that's another no-ball

slower, tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and blocks

pushes it towards long-off for a walking single. The throw hits the stumps but Brathwaite was watching the ball and had his bat grounded. And he gets one off the deflection too
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball on the stumps, defended from the back foot. Another no-ball
fuller on the pads, flicked towards backward square leg for a quick single

a legcutter. Length ball around off. Waits for it before defending
fuller on the stumps, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, goes for the drive but cannot beat extra cover
flatter on the stumps, pushes it towards short midwicket
quicker on the stumps once more. Defended back
fired in on to the pads, flicked towards square leg. Bowled at 94kph that one
short of length outside off, finds backward point with the cut
length ball around off, defended right under his eyes
length outside off, clears his front leg and looks to go over mid-off. But ends up miscuing it over extra cover. Calls for two and gets it easily
short of length around off, defended from the back foot
length ball outside off, steers it towards third man

bowled 'im. Fuller around off and middle, Brathwaite was looking to flick it towards square leg but misses. It keeps a touch low also and shatters into the stumps. Brathwaite was perhaps a bit causal. He isn't happy with himself and slams his bat into the ground
fuller outside off, pushes at it and manages it past gully. Two is the call but there is a chance for the third as well. But West Indies are happy with two
length outside off, comes forward and places it towards covers for a single
length outside off, looks to cut but it spins a bit to cramp the batsman
length ball around off, punched towards short midwicket
fuller around off, drives it towards long-on
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but a diving stop by the extra cover fielder
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-off
length ball outside off, tries to go over mid-off but fails to middle it. Gets it over extra cover though
fuller around off, pushes it towards deep extra cover, only a single though
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but gets a thick outside edge towards cover

short of length outside off, pushes it towards cover-point for a single. A direct hit at the keeper's end. And we are going upstairs. Holder's bat was in the air even though he was well in. Luckily he had his foot grounded just before the ball hit the stumps
a legcutter. On middle and leg. Holder was looking to work it on the leg side. Gets a thick outside edge behind point
length ball outside off, dabs it towards gully
walks towards the bowler, gets it on the full and drives it towards long-off. Fifty for Holder
length ball at the stumps, stays back and works it to the right of mid-on
fuller around off, looks to smash it over long-on but gets a thick outside edge over gully. Comes back for the second
short this time, Holder was backing away. Goes for the pull, gets top edge on that and it bounces over the fine leg boundary
length ball around off, gets behind it and blocks. Another no-ball
walks down the pitch and drives it towards long-off
short from Lakmal. Da Silva goes for the pull and he too gets a top edge. Over the keeper's head for four
good length ball on fifth stump at 137 kph, Holder reaches out to stab this away but can't get bat on it.
fullish length ball on fifth stump at 139 kph, Holder pokes at this but is beaten.
short and wide on seventh stump, taps this gently behind point but Da Silva isn't interested in sprinting for what may have been a tight single.
full on seventh stump, slapped off the toe to the cover sweeper.
bouncer on seventh stump at 137 kph, Da Silva slaps at this to send it high over backward point for a pair.
short and wide, tries to chop this away for a quick single but scuffs the shot into the ground.
attempted slower ball goes awry as a waist high full toss on fourth stump but Holder flubs a punch straight to cover.
yorker speared off the pads down the leg side, Holder can't flick it away but Dickwella doesn't corral it either and two leg byes are pinched.
low full toss on the legs, flicked behind square for more runs.
short ball on the stumps, slaps this to deep square leg.
bouncer on middle goes to pull and a top edge swirls into the leg side but lands safely well short and wide of deep square leg.
low full toss on middle at 128 kph, misfires on the attempted yorker and Da Silva punishes him with an on drive past a diving mid-on fielder and it races away.
full and wide yorker at 139 kph, Holder jams this out and angles the bat face perfectly with an open face to slice this in a gap behind point to the rope.
wide yorker again on fifth stump, Holder glides this a bit more gently to deep third man.
short on fifth stump at 120 kph, opens the face to glide this to deep third man.
yorker on the legs, flicked out to deep backward square.
wide yorker again on fifth stump at 144 kph, Da Silva scuffs this out off a toe to third man.
full and wide, punched into the covers for a tight single.
full and wide, carves this out through mid-off for one.
thigh high full toss as an attempted slower ball is misfired and Da Silva swats it to long-on.

wide yorker that Holder can't get bat on, Dickwella fumbles and Da Silva alertly calls him through to steal a bye. The throw is wild missing the non-striker's stumps and they pinch a second bye on the overthrow.
full on the stumps, flicked into the leg side for a pair.

good length ball straying on the hips at 126 kph, goes back to flick this through midwicket for three before it's slapped back in by Blackwood sliding at the rope. Third umpire has now changed it to four.
good length ball on fourth stump at 133 kph, defended.
good length ball on off stump at 130 kph, defended.
fullish length on fourth stump at 134 kph, defended into midwicket on the front foot.
back of a length on fourth stump, goes back to tap with soft hands behind point and sets off for a run before Karunaratne sends him back.
back of a length seaming away from fifth stump, presses forward to defend but is well inside the line of the ball shaping away.
good length ball angled across fourth stump, left alone.
back of a length on off stump, defended into midwicket. Third umpire signals down to the field that Holder has overstepped, and he's an inch or two over the line on the replay.
back of a length on the legs, flicks this behind square for a pair to get off the mark.
good length ball on the legs, flicked to square leg.
good length ball on off stump, defended.
back of a length on off stump at 127 kph, defended.

good length ball on sixth stump, left alone.
full and speared into the pads, Thirimanne is late flicking across the line. Huge lbw shout denied. May have been missing leg. West Indies opt to not go for a review.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
full on fourth stump at 125 kph, defended.
back of a length on fourth stump, defended into the ground short of third slip.
good length on fourth stump, big inside edge coming forward defending it into the pads.
back of a length angled down leg at 122 kph and left alone.
good length ball outside off, defended.

good length ball on fourth stump, defended.
back of a length on fourth stump at 130 kph, punches away from his body to find a gap in the covers for a single.
back of a length outside off, no run on this.
too full straying on the legs, flicks this very fine through fine leg and deep fine leg is too square to cut it off.
overpitched on fifth stump, punched back at Holder, who kicks it with a ricochet going to mid-on.
fullish length ball squares up Karunaratne on off stump, pushes at this and a thick edge goes to ground short of the slips.
good length ball on off, defended.

arm ball skids on from fifth stump, left alone.

shouts of catch it but Da Silva puts it down. Short of length down the leg side. Thirimanne tried to get away from the line, shouldering arms but it brushed his gloves on its way to the keeper. Da Silva moved well, got both gloves to it, was at a decent waist height but grassed in the end

length ball on the pads, flicked but short leg is in the way
short of length, just outside off. Thirimanne sways away from it

this once keeps coming in with the arm as Karunaratne looks to defend. An inside edge on to the pads

starts with a bouncer in the line of the stumps, ducked under
goes short again, pulls it over short leg who takes evasive action and ducks under it. Wasn't from the middle of the bat I think
